page.title: 12Tourism in Alford area
page.content: The AA four pennant caravan/camp site at Haughton House Country Park brings many visitors. The Georgian mansion house forms the centre piece with most facilities based there. The upper floors contain self-catering flats. The ranger service at the new inter- pretive centre give information about the countryside. As well as excellent recreational facilities locally, the park has nature trails and attractive picnic and play areas.It is one of Grampian's top tourist attractions. The Transport and Railway museums along with the narrow gauge railway are popular. Some visitors come to salmon fish in the Don, some to visit the many nearby castles and ski slopes. With these many facilities, attractive countryside and warm- heart ed folk tourism is a growth industry.
